description:
The second season of SPY×FAMILY.

The Forger family will face a new familial mission as Yor heads on a cruise ship expedition!

(Source: Crunchyroll News)

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Surfing
tags.description: Centers around surfing as a sport.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

node.description:
He was previously an assistant to [Tatsuki Fujimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119917/Tatsuki-Fujimoto) and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Katou)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_tatsuyaendo_)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古橋一浩)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).
Production assistant turned scriptwriter.

[Website](http://knowname.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4274802379)

A musical creative unit that handles a wide range of music for animation productions.

**Members:**
\- [NIKIIE](https://anilist.co/staff/150707) - vocalist
\- [Ayaka Tachibana](https://anilist.co/staff/150710/) - vocalist
\- [AIJ](https://anilist.co/staff/150708/) - vocalist
\- [R・O・N](https://anilist.co/staff/106037/) - music creator
\- [Makoto Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109497/) - music creator
\- [Shuuhei Mutsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/120035/) - music creator
\- [Kohei by SIMONSAYZ](https://anilist.co/staff/150793/) - music creator
\- [eNu](https://anilist.co/staff/150711) - music creator
\- [Genki Mizuno](https://anilist.co/staff/150709/) - music creator
\- [so-bin](https://anilist.co/staff/119090) - illustrator
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.
He formerly worked at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) and is currently working at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
He formerly worked at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) and is currently working at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/108529192) | [Website](https://www.art-setting.com/) | [Nico Nico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/662388)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).
Freelance sound effects creator.

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCln9P4Qm3-EAY4aiEPmRwEA) | [NicoNico](http://nicovideo.jp/mylist/58569901) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ado1024imokenp) | [Official Site (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/ado/)

Ado is a Japanese singer, composer and producer.

In 2014, Ado took an interest in music after a software of the video-sharing website Niconico was released on Nintendo 3DS. She began watching videos on the small screen of Nintendo 3DS, and was impressed by the cover singers on Niconico, who sang without showing their faces. Years later in 2017, Ado began singing as an utaite on Niconico, after uploading a video of herself singing a cover of "Kimi no taion".

On October 23, 2020, the day before her 18th birthday, she made her debut with the digital single titled "Usseewa". The song peaked at number 1 on Billboard Japan Hot 100, Oricon Digital Singles Chart, and the Oricon Streaming Chart. The music video of the song on her YouTube channel reached 100 million views in 148 days after its release. Reaching 100 million plays on Billboard Japan after 17 weeks from charting-in was the sixth fastest in history and the youngest for a solo singer. She currently belongs to the artist management company Cloud Nine.

On June 11, 2021, she was chosen as the second Japanese female Artist for "YouTube's Artist on the Rise".

On January 26, 2022, she released Kyougen (狂言), her first album.

On June 26, 2024, the J-Pop music group produced by Ado, Phantom Siita (ファントムシータ) debuted.

On July 10, 2024, she released Zanmu (残夢), her second album.

[Website](https://vaundy.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/vaundy_engawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/vaundy_engawa/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1FQWQ3y3-e8l1pCtWhJt5A)

Vaundy is a Japanese multi-talented artist who writes, composes and arranges music all by himself, his talents also expand to direction and self-production of designs and music videos.

Since his first music video posted on YouTube in spring of 2019, his songs “Tokyo Flash” and “Fukakouryoku” have since become social media sensations.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style. 

After graduating from the Kyushu Sangyo University's Faculty of Arts in 1987 he joined studio [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/Ajiado), initially as in-betweener but rapidly moving to key animation. 

In the first part of his career Yuasa established himself as an idiosyncratic creator while working on several child friendly anime, such as [Chibi Maruko-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/951/Chibi-Marukochan/) and [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2677/Doraemon-Nobitas-Animal-Planet/), but especially on [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/966/Shin-Chan/), a project he was involved with for most of the '90s. 

One of his breakthrough roles in this period was his participation on the second part of [The Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/12715/The-Hakkenden-Legend-of-the-Dog-Warriors-Part-2/), working as animation director under [Shinya Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/103893/Shinya-Oohira)'s direction. This OVA was an important outing of the '90s, uniting many veteran artists and talented newcomers. 

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. In 2013, he founded [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/Science-SARU) alongside his close affiliate [Eun-Yeong Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/EunYeong-Choi).

On March 25, 2020 it was announced Yuasa stepped down as the CEO of Science SARU. He would work there as director until the completion of his latest Movie, [Inu-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/109928/InuOh/), and would later cease any affiliation with the studio.

On February 17, 2025 it was announced that Yuasa would launch of his own animation studio, ame pippin. Their debut project would be the film [Daisy's Life](https://anilist.co/anime/190574/Hinagiku-no-Jinsei/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style.

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. __Atsushi Takahashi__ is a Japanese producer.
__Yoshihisa Heishi__ is a Japanese magazine editor, animation planner and producer. He currently works for Shueisha and was an editor-in-chief for Weekly Shounen Jump between 2011-2017.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/912360537622642688)

[Website](https://www.tateki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TatekiKobayashi)

Tateki Kobayashi is a singer-songwriter, lyricist, composer, and music producer. Graduated from Kindai University.
